import Mathlib.Topology.ContinuousFunction.Algebra
import Mathlib.Data.IsROrC.Basic

variable {R : Type*} [CommSemiring R] [TopologicalSpace R] [TopologicalSemiring R]

variable {ğ•œ : Type*} [IsROrC ğ•œ]

#synth Algebra R C(R, R) -- ContinuousMap.algebra
#synth IsScalarTower R C(R, R) C(R, R) -- IsScalarTower.right

#synth Algebra ğ•œ C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ) -- ContinuousMap.algebra

set_option trace.Meta.synthInstance true
set_option trace.Meta.isDefEq true
#synth IsScalarTower ğ•œ C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ) C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ) -- failed

  [] âŒ apply @IsScalarTower.right to IsScalarTower ğ•œ C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ) C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ) â–¼

      [isDefEq] âŒ IsScalarTower ğ•œ C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ) C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ) =?= IsScalarTower ?m.8431 ?m.8432 ?m.8432 â–¼
        [] âœ… ğ•œ =?= ?m.8431 â–¶
        [] âœ… C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ) =?= ?m.8432 â–¶
        [] âœ… C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ) =?= C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ)
        [synthInstance] ğŸ’¥ Algebra ğ•œ C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ) â–¶
        [] âŒ ContinuousMap.instSMul =?= Algebra.toSMul â–¼
          [] âŒ { smul := fun r f => { toFun := r â€¢ â‡‘f, continuous_toFun := â‹¯ } } =?= Algebra.toSMul â–¼
            [] âŒ { smul := fun r f => { toFun := r â€¢ â‡‘f, continuous_toFun := â‹¯ } } =?= ?m.8435.1 â–¼
              [] âœ… SMul ğ•œ C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ) =?= SMul ğ•œ C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ) â–¶
              [] âŒ SMul.smul =?= fun r f => { toFun := r â€¢ â‡‘f, continuous_toFun := â‹¯ } â–¼
                [] âŒ fun r f => { toFun := r â€¢ â‡‘f, continuous_toFun := â‹¯ } =?= fun a => SMul.smul a â–¼
                  [] âœ… ğ•œ =?= ğ•œ
                  [] âŒ fun f => { toFun := r â€¢ â‡‘f, continuous_toFun := â‹¯ } =?= SMul.smul r â–¼
                    [] âŒ fun f => { toFun := r â€¢ â‡‘f, continuous_toFun := â‹¯ } =?= fun a => SMul.smul r a â–¼
                      [] âœ… C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ) =?= C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ)
                      [] âŒ { toFun := r â€¢ â‡‘f, continuous_toFun := â‹¯ } =?= SMul.smul r f â–¼
                        [] âŒ { toFun := r â€¢ â‡‘f, continuous_toFun := â‹¯ } =?= ?m.8435.1.1 r f â–¼
                          [] âœ… C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ) =?= C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ)
                          [] âŒ (?m.8435.1.1 r f).toFun =?= r â€¢ â‡‘f â–¶
                          [] âŒ @ContinuousMap.mk =?= ?m.8435.1.1 â–¶
                          [onFailure] âŒ { toFun := r â€¢ â‡‘f, continuous_toFun := â‹¯ } =?= ?m.8435.1.1 r f â–¶
                          [onFailure] âŒ { toFun := r â€¢ â‡‘f, continuous_toFun := â‹¯ } =?= ?m.8435.1.1 r f â–¶
              [onFailure] âŒ { smul := fun r f => { toFun := r â€¢ â‡‘f, continuous_toFun := â‹¯ } } =?= ?m.8435.1 â–¶

Is pasting this into scratch.lean file at the root of mathlib supposed to bork the server?

oh, that's even worse. I didn't even notice that. I get that it prints this error:

4
54

146

144
The borking of the server is somehow due to the tracing (of the instances, not of the defeq), which seems very bad.
Itâ€™s not the problem but ContinousMap.C should be reducible
I am guessing metavariable depth is the culprit here

[] ğŸ’¥ ?m.18092 =?= ContinuousMap.instSemiringContinuousMap â–¼
                  [] ?m.18092 [nonassignable] =?= ContinuousMap.instSemiringContinuousMap [nonassignable]

it fails to get the algebra structure here and just continuous with a metavariable
But it gets the algebra structure fine when you ask it, see above.
Right, for some reason it goes deeper into the docs#Lean.MetavarContext.depth and tries to assign it there (is my theory)
It succeeds if you replace ğ•œ with â„, but not with â„‚.

Your idea about metavariable context depth seems likely because of the unassignable, but also note that this succeeds:

example : IsScalarTower ğ•œ C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ) C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ) := @IsScalarTower.right _ C(ğ•œ, ğ•œ) _ _ _
